qas.question: Which is the largest city not connected to an interstate highway?
In what year was the Interstate Highway System created?
Which State Route has been in discussion to upgrade to interstate standards?
What are the factors that are contributing to the desire to have SR 99 improved to be of interstate standards?

answers.text: rapidly raising population and traffic in cities along SR 99
rapidly raising population and traffic in cities along SR 99, as well as the desirability of Federal funding

qas.question: What is the largest city directly linked to an interstate?

plausible_answers.text: raising population and traffic in cities

qas.question: What was rapidly increasing by interstate 5?
What do many people want to integrate into interstate 5?
Which side is SR 99 built on?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b4_0>Fresno<b4_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> is the largest U.S. city not directly linked to an Interstate highway. When the Interstate Highway System was created <a1_1>in the <a1_0><b5_0>1950s<b5_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, the decision was made to build what is now Interstate 5 on the <b8_0>west<b8_0/> side of the Central Valley, and thus bypass many of the population centers in the region, instead of upgrading what is now <a2_1><a2_2>State Route 99<a2_2/><a2_1/>. Due to <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2>rapidly <b6_0>raising population and traffic in cities<b6_0/> along <b7_0>SR <a2_0>99<b7_0/><a3_0/><a2_0/>, as well as the desirability of Federal funding<a3_2/><a3_1/>, much discussion has been made to upgrade it to interstate standards and eventually incorporate it into the interstate system, most likely as Interstate 9. Major improvements to signage, lane width, median separation, vertical clearance, and other concerns are currently underway.
